It's so bad since the most recent update. You used to be able to run multiple filters at once, but now it closes out of the menu after every filter, and you have to go back in. Not only that, but you can only see 10 items at a time, but a lot of those items are "sponsored" and have nothing to do with your search. You have to click "next" to see more results, but when I click next, it removes all my filters. I've uninstalled it and installed it multiple times, but it still doesn't work.

This app has SERIOUS issues on Galaxy S9+. It is so distracting, it effects my buying habits. We spent $11,000 with Amazon last year... I can't believe they don't feel like their customers deserve an app that can consistently open product pictures in expanded view or that can search reviews like the desktop site. I am very disappointed. Older phones seem to open enlarged product photos fine and going directly to the website in a browser allows searching reviews so....why use the app???

I love shopping on Amazon, but the new update is extremely difficult to use. I don't want to view a few items per page. I prefer scrolling all the way down. I also don't like the new feature that it only allows me to filter one item at a time before showing me the results. It takes much longer, and I sometimes give up. I think Amazon may lose money. Go back to the previous version please!

This app has NEVER crashed on me before this stupid "gift" update. Now if I search by price, I get about a dozen swipes and the screen twitches hard then goes white and reboots. Also, searches are getting worse. If I specify department or price, it should ONLY reduce the selection number, but now, it only increases by thousands, or I get three. Not even possible.

What is really irritating with Amazon is the inability to give them any kind of feedback. The recent advertising on their site on both browsers and apps reduces the functionality of the website and you can't dismiss adverts for things you're not interested in. Some of the adverts include a cross to close them but this doesn't work. Chat responses are broken and I don't want a call: I want to push information to their web or IT department but can't.

*Edit: Seems like if you're not a Prime member, the app response is broken: it was laggy from the start (when I had a membership) but then it just became completely unresponsive & I have to tap something on the UI 4 times before anything happens, & that's with WiFi connection. 2ndly, the app offered me a free 12 month Prime trial, but after signing up for it, I instead got just 30 days, then after that trial ended, got billed $130 for a yr subscript. Ha! Lastly, billing reminders do *not work.

'Unable to contact Amazon within the Android app'. After trying to send Amazon an email within their app for the last 30 minutes, I am left wondering if they want to be contacted at all. Each attempt is meet with an error. Also forget trying to send a seller a question, no option. Was the international version of this app an afterthought... seriously poor form.

great items; aweful filtering system. almost impossible to narrow down results in a reasonable way. you have to repeat the process over and over if u have more than one filter. and the options for filters are different for each search, and hardly ever has the filter i need, such as price range, and others. but i do love amazon. just not the filter option. definitely needs fixed. i wish theyd do the filter options the same way as the walmart or ebay apps. aside from that id rate it 5 stars.

I hate when developers mess with apps that are perfectly fine ðŸ˜¡! They got rid of continuous scroll with previous and next buttons which would be okay if they gave you the option of changing it back or making it show more per page. And for what? So they can put an ad at the bottom of each page. Like Amazon doesn't make enough money and needs to make more money from stupid ads?!

This app has gone back and forth with having endless scrolling and being able to hold and drag an item into a wishlist. Then no matter the device I have it seems to crash constantly. And when adding to a Wishlist was drag and drop before it would crash it would change the list you were adding things in to a completely different list without warning. Very buggy and lagging. Im hoping that the app is the way it is now because they're fixing these problems that should have been resolved ages ago...

Used to be great, but the new app is terrible. Narrowing down searches takes too long with the new style. Previous versions would allow for constant scrolling, now you have to hit next after only showing a few items, and when you do, oftentimes all of your filters will be gone. Please return the app to how it was. How could this have passed for an update. Severe downgrade.

VERY LAGGY; buttons don't always work even though scrolling is available. Attempts to enlarge pictures works about 25% of the time. "Buy Now" or "Add to Cart" also work intermittently. It's often faster to get my notebook out and shop in a browser than to use the app. FRUSTRATING! The other day, I tapped on an image over 90 times in various spots before I could get it to show the enlarged photo. Same thing on my phone AND my tablet.

App used to work quickly and as expected. In recent months - maybe there was a bad update - it's so laggy it's unusable. Pages jump and taps are registered slowly which causes the wrong part of the page to register the tap, consequently the wrong item is chosen etc. I have done all the troubleshooting that I can from my phone's end clearing cache, uninstalling and reinstalling, closing all other apps, adequate memory etc. None of my other apps have this issue. I'm back to the desktop site.

New updated App, great. Using my Galaxy S8+ I don't see a 'Log out' option?? It's not on the drop down options when you click the top left screen once logged in to your account. Or is that the point? That you stay logged in the whole time? The App is not intuitive to use if one cannot easily find the log out button, is it?! A helpful suggestion would be to improve that.

I like this app a lot but I liked it better when I could just add items quickly to my list. I also liked it better when it didn't crash. When I say crash, I mean it. The screen or picture turns black and I have to exit the app entirely. This gets frustrating when you're searching for that perfect thing. Overall I like the app, just needs some fixing. Update: they've added a heart feature which makes it easier to add items to your preferred list which is great!

It needs to be fixed ASAP. Previous versions, allowed to display the rest of the text from the reviews, by clicking on the "more" blue text. I mean, if the review is several lines long, it does not fit in the preview screen, you need to press it in order to continue reading the full review. On the last couple of versions, pressing the "more" blue text, does nothing. So, I can not read, the full text of each long review.

Pfft, what's wrong with the search engine? The results I get are what amazon "thinks" I'm looking for and not what I typed. I can't properly sort by price because once again, Amazon sorts the products by what it "thinks" to be the cheapest deal and it filters out some of the search results in doing so. Why isn't there an option to set max and min price? Why is the app so unresponsive? I see these nuances as an attempt to stop the buyer from getting the cheapest deals. What a scummy thing to do.

Missing key Amazon Prime features! I thought the Amazon App would be great since I shop there a lot. But I soon realized, that with the Amazon app you cannot donate to a charity the way you can on the website! Also if you ever do Prime Pantry where are the essentials are cheaper, this cannot be done from the app. Amazon seems unable or unwilling to fix either problem. The search engine is also terrible! I have literally put in exactly the name of what Amazon calls a product and not find it!

It's a hit or miss on if I will actually get my package now. I used to not have any issues. Now my packages are either delivered to the incorrect address, lost, or damaged and being returned to sender. I'm literally ordering stuff just to get refunds 2 weeks later. It's annoying and I don't think I'll be ordering from Amazon anytime soon. I'll be doing my shopping elsewhere.

This app is garbage. The app doesn't register when you select "Add to Cart" or "Add to List" the majority of the time so you have to fiddle about with it by moving the screen and clicking on it. I had this problem with my old phone and my new Pixel 3. Totally ridiculous how difficult it is to purchase something in this app when the old Amazon Underground app worked fine.

the apps layout is easy to Navigate but very glitchy, items in my list often go into different ones, the app crashes very often or freezes then goes back to a previously looked at items, sometimes the screen is very sensitive and it opens up everything while scrolling or wont even open stuff at all, the list at the bottom randomly switches causing me to drag items into the wrong list or the list i want will not open up instead loadings for a minute then going back to the previously open list. :)

It does its job when it works. Orderung, tracking, and shipping is seamless. The only gripe I have with this app is that it constantly crashes and sometimes stalls while loading screens. It's not hardware issue or WiFi, since I've checked, my connection is fast at >70mb/s cable line. I'm running the latest updates.

Ok but not as good as the old app. My wish lists were all separated and neatly organized and easy to add to and take from on the old app. now they are are jumbled mess and everything I add to any wishlist ends up in one list even if I didn't save it to that one. please fix this issue! some things are meant for private lists and are showing on my public lists.

This app was fine before the update! I loved infinite scroll and what was done to the filters is ridiculous! Now it's only a few per page and hitting next just wastes time and sometimes the page doesn't even load. The filter you have to choose one at a time then the whole screen goes back to the results and takes up the entire screen! The filter was perfect before! The app also crashes frequently and all my permissions are on and working fine. Get rid of this update!

I made the mistake of updating from an older version and there are just too many ads that take up lots of screen space right in the middle of search results. Completely unnecessary given how much revenue Amazon generates. Filtering shouldn't require going into filters after each individual selection; let me select multiple filters and then apply.

I WAS head over heels in love with the Amazon App :/ but they removed the "Wishlist Tray Drag & Drop" feature without a single word or explanation as to why. Such a bummer & sooo disappointing. I don't think they have a clue how much that feature helped everybody out. It was extremely simple, yet able to to cut down on a lot of extra time & work.

Love the app, hate the new icon. Shopping on the app is as fluid as you'd expect with a desktop experience. The latest app icon is the reason I had to give 4 stars instead of 5. I used to be able to locate it so easily. Even though the app is in the same spot all the time, a non-descript image keeps blocking my muscle memory (it just doesn't stand out compared to my other shopping apps). I would love to see the old icon return or something more like it.

I use this app once a week and it's awful. I find I have to flip to the browser version half the time just to get around its horrible ability to search. Its search is so weighted and verging to outright lying to you. from not finding products, to hiding them deep in a list. the same criteria on the website will give you a very diffrent picture. I still use this app for a few convenient things, but never for research.

Used to love shopping with Amazon but now it's an absolute hassle. The app now only displays the lowest price of items rather than the fact the listing is for multiple items at varying prices. EX you see a shirt listed as 7.99$, click on it then see the price ranges from 7.99$-34.99$, pick a size to find out said shirt is now 24.99$. Also you no longer have the options to set a price range to find products in yourself. To top it off if you filter from low to high, results drop from 80000+ to 50.

Love AMZ, the app is so frustrating. When searching w/ the Android app: when you tap filter it is so delayed you're often not sure if you tapped in the right spot (needs a bigger sensor area) and due to the huge delay when you tap again you end up taping the sort button on the next page. When you press Android's back button (no in app back button) you're taken back to search results and not the previous filter menu. It's next to impossible to filter and when you do you have to keep going back.

Neato App, But Scrolling Broken. When searching, after 4-6 products in the results there is always this section where the scrolling is dead. No matter where I drag up or down within that box, the screen does not move up or down to the rest of the search results, as if Amazon purposely wants you to stare at those 2 products for much, much longer than you would have originally. This is new with the most recent update.

The app was just fine until a couple months ago. I hate that it kicks you out everytime you click something in the filter, and then you have to go back in again to click something else. Not a fan of having to click next after seeing only 10 or so items, with half of them being paid advertising. I definitely do not look at as many items as when I could scroll aimlessly. I don't get great service or Internet, so the constant reloading and waiting drives me nuts!!

Why do i have to call ups when ups is not dropping my package off? Also dont have the option to cancel. Currently waiting on the phone for 40 minutes to talk to ups, if i have to do this again i will think three times before ordering the next product. Edit: amazon has no option to say that the package never arrived, lowering score to two stars. I dont want to deal with this. Edit, amazon accepted the return automatically.

The most recent update is inconvenient. Applying multiple filters for searches is troublesome as you must manually go back now to utilize more than 1 at a time. Limiting the amount of product on each screen and having a "Next Page" feature now is annoying. I have given up on websites that use this method. Not a fan of this update, may delete app after years of use if improvements aren't made or an older version available.

I hate being forced to update an app that is working and when I do I get a pale imitation of the one that I loved! This app is slow and stops and says "open app again" so I do. And guess what? I have to start all over again to get to the item where it cut me off! Absolutely HATE this! You need to fix it or bring the old app back...I have been loving Amazon up to now but this is enough aggravation to change my mind!

App is now crashing nonstop, can't use. In general, the app still has a lot of laborious click-through like the website. If it can get back up and running, it would be nice to see easier filtering of searching and full package tracking history with a more user friendly UI. It still feels a lot like the website.

Unable to exit app without having to start from homescreen every time I reopen the app. Extremely frustrating while looking at registries. Also when I try to filter there are very few options.. I cant filter by price range. And when I try to change sorting options it takes away most of the results. Love Amazon but not a fan of the app.

Crashes all the time when viewing previously ordered items. The app shows a random dog and says Ugh-Oh. Have tried with many items, have tried on 3 separate Samsung Galaxy S8+ phones. Has been happening for over a year. Uninstall and reinstall, as well as complete phone reset do not help. It's amazing that Amazon has still not fixed this problem after so long.

I used this app all the time. It was extremely useful in keeping updated on my orders. Unfortunately, following an update and a password change I simply cannot log on to the app any more. A message "The specified device cannot be authenticated. Try again later..." pops up upon entering my correct password. The app works fine on iOS, and I am able to log into my Amazon account via a browser. It's just the Android app doesn't want to know. A call to the help desk didn't help in the slightest...

Underground was way better!! Recently forced to switch to this due to support stopping for underground... This does not come close to the deals, the search results, or or even how user friendly it is... I HATE having to flip pages for search results!!! If we were able to change the amount of results on each page would be better, include some of the underground deals (instant mp3 with purchase of CD) and I would be MUCH happier!!

Can't say how often I open Amazon through a notification, try to switch apps to research the item and then try to switch back to Amazon only to find it's not open in the background. Was just going to submit a question about an item, but jumped to chrome to check facts and couldn't get back to Amazon app to submit my question. ugh... now i have to go find the item and type question again. Also, I'm certain I've reviewed some items via the app in the past that no longer have my reviews.

It usually runs fine i guess, the layout changes are a huge inconvenience. In the last 3 days i have been unable to use it despite uninstalling, updating, etc, because the app crashes immediately upon opening. The company is abominable but sometimes i need fast shipping so i keep it around. If i werent broke, morals alone would keep me from shopping here.

Overall I was happy with this app but lately it has been crashing at least once a week. Nice picture of a cute dog to tell me something went wrong but the cuteness fades when it is always crashing. The only fix is to reboot my phone or remove and reinstall. This time I removed the app permanently and just added a bookmark to login from the website. I would have thought Amazon would have fixed this bug buy now. I've searched for a reason only to find many people have the same problem and no fix.

Amazon is one of my favorite apps. Although I would like to suggest to make a purchase security code(4digit pin) before charging the card to confirm the purchase. That way if you have long stay visitors and order unwanted apps or movies on your firestick they wont be able just to abuse your account, or it would also be helpful if it had an option on your payments for activate or deactivate(on-off) your card payments.

Never reviewed this app til now. I really dont like the new way the app is played out. I loved the tap and drag to list function, and the continuous scrolling when browsing. Get rid of the next and previous buttons, bring back continuous scrolling, and also bring back the tap and drag to lists function and rating will improve drastically. Would have given a 5* but now you only get 1*

The app used to be really good. However, I've recently been getting constant - and I mean CONSTANT - crashes. I can't even even go 4 links deep into the app without the screen going randomly black and white, with severe unresponsiveness. I've tried contacting support with my issue, but their Twitter support page says to contact their email, and despite several email reports, I've recieved dead air. I am now forced to use a Web browser to make purchases and manage my account.

I love shopping on Amazon & the app is pretty good. Only problem is that occasionally when I try to add something to my cart or buy it now on the mobile app it does neither no mater how hard I press on my phone. Also sometimes have problems when trying to see a picture larger. After clicking on it I suddenly get a message that image isn't available. Other than that I'm really happy with Amazon. I especially love Amazon Smile. I wish they would incorporate it into an app. Thank you.

Great access to products. However the search feature is not at all desireable. When I put in sort price low to high and prime only, im given a list like this: $500, $99, $600 (not prime), $400(amazon choice), $106. This is NOT what I searched for. When i put in my parameters, that is what Im willing to spend. I dont want to have more expensive products taking up screen space. Horrible nasty marketing techniques used in this application that make it undesireable to use for browsing.

I bought the Express directly from Roku expecting better performance than my Roku LT. Slightly faster but needed to be unplugged each time to connect to HDMI. For 12 days I've been trying to return defective unit. Ignored for 5 days, now being pestered to try work arounds to get Express to work. Worst customer service I've ever encountered. 12 days without an RMA. Did you ever hear of such a thing? update: took 2 months to get refund after returning item with Fedex RMS supplied by Roku. disgrace

App doesn't accurately reflect order/return. I returned an item a week after it arrived almost a month ago. The app shows that the refund has been credited but the item is still shown in transit. I've called Amazon 3 times and they assure me the error is on their end and they've corrected it but my account status still doesn't update. There's a design flaw somewhere in the app.

I love the app as I can shop and search for things on the go. however there was a feature that I loved and got used to using that they seemed to have taken away? whenever I was shopping, I used to be able to click on the image and drag it to the list at the bottom. if I needed to change the list i could... it's been about a month now that I cannot use that feature. I mean...#FirstWorldProblems but it was easier to shop that way. otherwise it'd of gotten 5 stars.

It's a solid app running a version of Chrome browser. Permissions are reasonable and can be switched on and off without effecting functionality. The only thing is like all 3rd party apps you are granting certain privacy rights that you don't need to when browsing with a good browser. That being said, it's Amazon they already have all your information anyway so the app is quicker and easy to use. I personally prefer using the app because it's lightweight and is quick.

App keeps freezing on my moto-e5. Lists function is totally useless, can't add, delete or move items between lists or to cart without freezing. While shopping, app freezes or goes to something random and unrelated to what I'm looking at. For example, I'm looking at wire and click to look at details and it jumps to security camera systems etc. Please fix this app. Error messages include " amazon shopping has stopped" and "amazon has encountered an error. please try again later".

They changed the app without permission. Now when shopping you veiw 10 items then have to go to another page. On slower phones it can take 4 ever. I used to be able to scroll all items related on 1 page. This sucks. And they had NO PERMISSION!!!! When I called, and had to ask for America 1st(as always) the witch hung up on me cuz I wanted tech & not her.

Good app. Horrible customer service. Was offered 5 bucks for a package that's taking 2 months to get here. Despite having prime and ordering it with the free two-day shipping. Apparently they also have a limit on how many times they can transfer you to someone higher. It's once. Edit: I've spent thousands on Amazon since last holiday season. Going back to brick-n'-mortar.

I love the free two day shipping with Prime and being able to watch movies and TV shows for free on our TCL Roku TV app. The only thing I hate is the app being unresponsive/ not loading the home page or an item when I click on it which is becoming too often. Everyone saying there's no difference between Prime and paying for two day shipping is wrong. A subscription by month or yearly pays for itself with free shipping if you use it somewhat often but some people don't comprehend that.

Terrible App Update! I've been a Prime member for a while and for the first time I am considering leaving. This App is a step down from the Amazon Underground App. The sponsored ads seem to be more of the focus than what you've actually searched for. Not to mention the layout and number of results you receive. There should be an option to change the view from grid to list. We now have to select next page to continue viewing items every ten or so items. This App is terrible!

Eliminate last android update for Galaxy Note 9. No continuous scrolling. Filter selection sends right back to product list so you are unable to select multiple options to filter. Filter menu is no longer a window: now is a new page. Also, for the last few months prior to the last upgrade, the tray is gone, which was very useful. Please fix asap as I use the app daily. These changes are a deterrent.

APP CRASHES EACH LOAD TIME!!! Fourth attempt to load this app. Uninstalled and reinstalled several times; it crashes each time right after loading. I did get to experience using the app a little before it starting continuously crashing. Now, it will load and immediately crash although it installs fine. Mutiple crash reports have been submitted. Please fix!

What's with the "Next Page" button all of a sudden? Going for a retro look? At least it slows down my Amazon browsing and keeps me from spending less, but also more likely to but something from the first few pages, realize there's a better product on page four for less money, and return the item. Sounds like a lose-lose for Amazon.

Quality has fallen. Tapping on the "View Lists" (plural) menu takes you to your most recent list (singular), where you are required to tap a separate "View Lists" link to actually view your lists. Increased ads and upselling have contributed to screen noise, sometimes making it confusing as to which item is being viewed.

It's been all good with me, there is a lot to choose from, I am happy with the quality, it's easy to locate item's and easy to go through the ordering process. I been pretty happy with the shipping, my orders have show up on the time frame Amazon says it will if not before. The shipping packaging has always been great to keep thing' fro getting damage. I only had one item come in broken and it was a cell phone case, and it wasn't due to packaging because it had penty of protection.

i got this app for the $10 code, only to google (b.c the ad/info for it disappears as soon as you click it& it takes you to the app store..) and find out it'll be emailed to me within 7-10 days.. thx, i wanted to use it now. they can send a payment email in 3 seconds, but that takes 7days..?? I've never had a problem w. my payment method before, and I seldomly use amazon but with the app it wouldnt accept payment, so i went onto the website and it worked fine. a complete waste of my time, imho.

For months it's been saying it will no longer be supported and to open the web version. There isnt even an update to install instead, just forces you onto their web version which is incredibly slow, unresponsive, buggy and annoying. What's up Amazon, dont want me shopping addiction dollars anymore? It's gotten so frustrating I've just resorted to google shopping!

The app is performing poorly compared to the chrome and web version. A lot of features like "Add to List" and "Add to cart" NEVER respond but the Amazon home page does. As a result I cant add anything to my cart for days now or even save the items to my list for later after browsing. Hope you guys fix this app issue, I have the new s10 too and it's been going on for a little over 1 week now.

Still my go-to app for shopping on Amazon, but it's become a hassle with the past few updates. Adding products to My List isn't as easy before since it doesn't pop-up on every page, mainly only on the home screen. The app itself lags quite a bit and it shouldn't on my phone, nothing else does. But, it's still more convenient than navigating their massive website.

Wow they downgraded their app. Searching for an item and actually needing to go page by page makes it impossible to shop. Why would it be necessary to go back to what their app was a few years back? The worst thing to happen was removing the ability to drag items to lists anymore. Can we also talk about how the search results are nowhere near the key words that one inputs in the search. The filtering option needs so much work its ridiculous. Amazon customers are asking for change please listen.

App has not been working correctly for a few weeks. the last 3 days I have been trying to purchase items & the home screen won't even load. Pops a picture of a dog saying "oops, something went wrong. go to home page" clicking just reveals another dog with the same prompt. I have checked for updates, uninstalled & reinstalled with the same results. works fine from a browser which leaves me to believe this is an issue with the app itself.

So I just updated my Amazon because I haven't in a while and I come to find out all the stuff I loved and just got used to are changed. Such as the scrolling screen i have to press a next button now just wish there was an option to turn it back. The heart is useful but in the previous version all I had to do was drag the image into the list now I have to click on the item to get to the heart kinda difficult due to the fact that I cant see well. Overall pretty great just miss some of the easier.

I love shopping with Amazon, but this is the slowest app I've ever used. None of the other apps on my phone run as slow as the Amazon app, so I know it's not my phone. It freezes when I try to add something to my cart, to a list, and even when I'm just trying to swipe to view additional pictures of an item. And it takes forever just for the app to open. As much as Amazon is worth, you would think they would be able to create one of the fastest apps available rather than the slowest.

App used to work well, but now it's very slow and not user friendly. It only allows you to select one filter before sending you back to the product list, if you want to narrow down the search more you have to do it one at a time. When you select sort by lowest-highest price it removes a bunch of the items from the view instead of filtering them all

The app crashes often and goes all black screen. I try to close out of app, but it freezes my phone. If the app wasn't trying to load so many pics of what others bought or similar items or other up-sells, this might not happen. Instead only give 5-8 "similar item" pics and them give links to those options, incase others want to see them.

The most annoying thing for me is that I will have 2000 results and when I sort my results by anything other than featured, I only get 50 - 100 results. With this latest update, it closes the filter menu every time you pick a filter and not only that, it does it slowly. My amazon shopping is going to decrease as a result of the app becoming so frustrating. This is just for the app not Amazon.

Amazon doesn't stand by what they say. They switch orders and delivery dates on with out telling. I'm done with Amazon I will not renew my prime membership that I had for 4 years now. I rather use walmart at least they stand by and behind there product and words. If they mess up they fix it. Amazon messes up they dont care to fix it at all. They try to make it seem like it's your fault. I rather wait for 3 weeks on ebay then to use Amazon..-100 rating. Using you is a option not the only choice.

The app is slow and non responsive. Clicking color options and sizes (for clothes to be more specific) lags and freezes up the rest of my phone. I can't use anything until it crashes. It takes too long for the prices to show up for each option. I do like the layout though. Earlier today I tried to delete items off my wish list and I have to sit there for a while after clicking the delete button for it to do anything. (Also wish Amazon would bring back the "drag down" to add to my lists.)

There is a learning curve with the products on here and I strongly urge anyone to read at least some reviews. Many products are either poorly made or as the case is with many clothes, from china. Sizes are different there and they rip you off with returns. Also take the time to fully read a product's description to save you the hassle of returning later. My biggest gripe is with deliveries. My specific instructions on where to put packages is only followed by the usps,out of common sense.

in general it's working great, the only con is that if you click on a picture to enlarge it, it opens a new window and the wheel keeps spinning (it's unable to open the picture - all you see is a white screen with the little toothed wheel spinning forever...). Very unsatisfying! I'm going to delete this app and use their website instead, except you developers have mercy with me and fix this issue!!! Update May 4th, 2019 The issue discribed has apparently been resolved... Thank you Amazon ðŸ‘

Amazon is a very large company that has a very big problem with letting you keep your money. Two times in the last month I have been charged for Amazon prime without even accessing my account or any type of Amazon service. I highly advise using Visa cards with this app as one version of the membership is $120 billed without request, and personally I like to make the decision to spend my own money, not have an algorithm strip it from my bank account.

When im frustrated enough to write a negative review, its a problem... I would rather shop websites than apps any day, but I was offered a $10 account credit for downloading this one... I never got it. First I was told days later that the offer had just expired. Ok, but what does that have to do with me, right? I downloaded it days before the promo expired, and was never sent the credit. Then I was told I had to be a prime member to be eligible for the offer "sorry." That's it.

I love Amazon, but lately, it's been acting up. It takes a long time to open and sometimes it just closes by itself. The pictures take a long time to load. I tried restarting my phone, I checked that I didn't have too many apps running at the same time and I even checked if there was any updates on the app and my internet speed. Should look into it.

Please will you sort out your option for free delivery!! Whenever I click on this option that is the point the app crashes and won't allow me to do it!! I have spoken to your people about it already and nothing has changed - despite being told that the problem will be looked into! - I have tried refreshing the page/ logging out and back in/ using the desk top and it's not working! Please sort it as I am so reluctant to have to pay for delivery when I don't have to!

Beware, Automatic Prime Trial Enrolment I installed this app after many years of using Amazon without prime. The very first screen that pops up in the app asks you to try Amazon Prime. I misclicked the "Get Started" button, but immediately hit the back button to return to the home page. There's a "Continue" button on the next page, which I did not click, so I thought nothing of it. I had not confirmed any sort of trial or sub, but then I got an email stating otherwise. Sneaky and dishonest.

This app is very annoying for my android phone. It lags and the lists have frustrated me so much! I spend time building a list, adding things to the stupid tray and it changes the list randomly without my realizing it! So I keep adding stuff to the wrong list then I can't move stuff in bulk from one list to the other and I have to move things one by one. It just did this to me for the 3rd time today and I'm super annoyed with this app. Please fix!

Overall interface is ok. The search function is a bit strange in how it deals with the back button but is acceptable. one recurring issue is that I have notifications set on, order things regularly, and have literally never received a notification indicating when my package has arrived, or any other shipment updates.

The new update is awful and misleading. When you search for items it'll show you the lowest price but when you click on items it gives you a huge price range, you have to choose from the set of items they've collected as similar and these items are out of stock or sold by scam sellers. Sorting by prime eligible doesn't help because the initial list will show prime eligible items but once you click on something the list you get is made up of random sellers. Amazon needs a more trustworthy set up.

App was better befor. The filters were easier to select and use drop and drag was a good feature and very useful hate that it is gone. And only being able to see 15 or so items before having to hit next or back it you want to look at a previous item is very time consuming not to mention it dose nor always show the number of items that it says was found when searching for something it was better when you could scroll up or down to look at things.

A.I. customer support. Issues go unresolved. Items are falsely advertised and the root of the problem never goes away because Amazon doesnt even realize its going on. A vendor can sell you item, take the money from your account, "ship" the order and then cancel the order and change the price on an item. Same item, same vendor (MC Muchbuy), 3 different prices, no resolutions. USE AT YOUR OWN RISK. Just remember that there ARE other places to shop that have great deals and low prices and less bs.

Usually a great app, but I'm forced to uninstall it and just use browser version. I have the endless dog error page loop. I've cleared cache and local storage and uninstall / reinstalled the app with no luck. If this was temporary it wouldn't be a huge deal. However, so far it's been at least a week that way. Which is just disappointing

This app is filled with bugs. I love Amazon, but this app is becoming an annoyance to use. Every time I open it, it tells me it's no longer supported and needs updated. I've "updated" it about a dozen times, completely deleted and reinstalled, etc. Still having the same issue. As I read other reviews I also saw how many of the same issues I was having as others. This thing just needs updating. For as rich as Bezos is, it shouldnt be difficult to hire devs that know how to create a flawless app.

Amazon is making making it hard to search for specific items and compare prices. I shop a lot on amazon but its aggravating to see features diminish instead of improve. I can't shop from lowest price to highest price without losing most of the items in the search. I can't see the lowest price for a specific size/color anymore. It's not cool.

I have been a very frequent Amazon shopper (my wife more than I but nonetheless) but this most recent update has made me stop using it completely. I didn't have a choice, every time I opened the app it would immediately tell me that the app had stopped working before even initially loading up the app. I went as far as to completely uninstall and reinstall the app to no difference at all. Maybe in the future if this works out I'll go back but in the current state, this app is useless

Since the new updates the drag and drop feature to add things to the wishlist and view the wishlists is gone. That alone is worth negative stars however the lag in the app is also horrendous. Just about every time I try to use the app it takes forever to load the pages or just decides it's time to just stop working altogether and crashes. I am using a Google pixel, 64gb with an internet speed of 150mbs so there is no reason for this to be happening. These issues also plague the rest of my family

This app is terrible. I was redirected to update the app and I did. Now it does not load and if by chance I can get into the app ut is so slow and lags terribly. The filter usage takes so long its damn near a full time job. I definately will not be shopping Amazon for Christmas, or anythung else. Terrible, frustrating waste of time. So disappointing.

Constantly get notification that Amazon has stopped working on my phone. By constantly, I mean multiple times when I'm on my phone doing other things! Choice to close app does nothing to stop these notifications, so I'm about ready to uninstall!!! It doesnt even say WHICH Amazon app it is! And theres NO option to report problems with the app or even search FAQs within the troubleshooting menu!

No Real Filters. Amazon is terrible at giving sorting filters. Most the time don't even allow to set price range leaving a person scrolling through tons on pages when price is a factor. Computer parts have been the worst with search filters and usually don't even have the options one truly needs when looking for computer/electronics parts. I guess the app does what it's supposed to, only Amazon needs to design much better AI to add appropriate filters.

Whenever you have to get a hold of them for issues or just a simple question, they send you to an automated 'chat' system. It only allows you to respond in the form of selecting pre generated options that you click on, but none of them pertain to your problem. And when they let you finally type, it doesn't even respond in any meaningful way. It merely reposts the previous options for you to select from. There is no option to get a real human on the chat, and there is no email to contact. WTAF

Overall good app. Baby registry is very annoying to use though. When I click an item on my registry, (to view detail, to delete or change item setting) and then click back, it sends be all the way back the top of the registry. So I keep having to scroll back down to wgere I was at. It's very annoying!!! It's easier to use on a computer than the app.

I use Amazon for pretty much everything. Since the most recent update, hitting Buy Now once charges me twice and sends two items. I've tried to only purchase items by going to my cart and checking out that way, but every now and then it will slip my mind and I'll end up with two items and have to go out of my way to return one. I would really like this issue resolved.

Wow.. Since this last upgrade, entirely disappointed.. Why bring back the completely detestable "next" button? Plus, your filters are so limited. I want to choose a color on any category and I am being given two, yes, TWO color options at a time. I was looking at curtains and want purple for a kids room, my filter options? Black or gold!! No other color was offered in the filter. Was looking at comforters, filter options were grey or yellow!! I wanted red!! Return our options, no NEXT button!

App was ok,.. originally. Now it lags horribly even though my network is stellar. Im 40 years old though, and I grew up in the age of dial-up, so I feel Im a little more patient than the younger generation. My real peeve is the search feature & refinements which HAVE NEVER worked like they should. Every refinement takes you back, you cant choose more than one at a time. And search leaves out a lot, like A LOT! Google it first then direct link to amazon if you really want to find something.

It's very very bad when you are cancelling my orders without any reason and without any communication from your teams... i was waiting for delivery and it was late. So when i checked it was cancelled order... three times happened to me when i ordered discounted items only but if items without discount they will deliver it easily.... I will never use this app any more

Lost my shipment, then lost the replacement shipping. Then, to top it off, after 8 phone calls and 3 hours, they told me they could "refund my shipping"... Which was free! Now I won't have the Paperwhite I ordered in time for vacation, and the best they can do is refund my non existant shipping. Thanks for nothing. Wish there were 0 stars. Their customer service is a joke, put me on hold and then hung up.

Dear Amazon Support, Hope all is well. Unfortunately the new app is functioning very poorly. The best feature was continuous scrolling and now you have to click through every few items, it is very limiting when you have to look through many items. Also when sorting buy price after the first page the sort does not work. It goes back to another sort criteria. Thank you for your consideration and help with rectifying these concerns. Sincerely appreciated, Louis

Add a filter that shows me products that will actually ship to my location. Tired of clicking on products and getting told "this item requires special handling and does not ship to your location". Pretty much everything I click tells me that. Never had a problem with Amazon before but I guess I need to start shopping somewhere else.

not compatible with chrome. it used to be, but not anymore. very disappointing. even the fixes are not available. ive been a prime member for over 14 years and im getting annoyed with alexa not understanding, me not being able to play product videos in the shopping app, how dificult it is to find movies by date added and genre. please stop complicating things. its too much

My phone usually lasts a whole day's use and loses about 8% battery through the night. I changed nothing, installed Amazon and 60% of battery was gone when I woke up. Serious issues. And using the app, one of the most annoying things was they show products that don't even ship to my location! On the web Amazon, if I give my address, it will not show products that don't ship to me; but this app does for some bizarre reason. It's so annoying.

Customer service answered every question I had and gave me information about services provided by Amazon that I didn't know about. Answering time was very fast with very little key pad selections to speak with someone. Awesome for so many services provided, shopping, music, videos, books, groceries for that price. It's insane, paying for all these services individually would cost so much. I am enjoying the free trial so much, I will be purchasing full membership once free trial is done.

Terrible app. Comes off as low effort. It's just a web portal that requires more permissions. If you do anything intensive like manage wish lists the app bugs out quite often. I've gotten my laptop several times because I don't trust the app. Really low bar set from one of the largest companies on Earth. Make a faster more caps capable app please.

One of the best but basic customer service experiences you can find. Real fast delivery options and secure lockers if you decide that instead of your address. The app is simple and easy to use. You can also track your package and see exactly how many stops away the driver is. The ads are too much and some customers feel outraged by them.

Search results not show or found in app but able to on browser page. No matter what you try to search on app will not show results. End up I had to use the web browser instead. It's quite buggy and slow in updates notification like shipment or delivery. Amazon please do something, it's working fine until september updates which causes all this issue.

Serious problem when I have to uninstall the app just to read a product description. The mobile site and app are very bad at showing all the information for a product. I prefer to shop on their website with desktop mode enabled so I can actually see all relevant info. Clicking a link in the browser was forcing the page to open in the Amazon app itself which meant I kept getting limited info on my screen. I had to uninstall the app just so I could view the entire product info and reviews.

Installed this because old app kept saying 'support for this app will end soon'. Never got past start-up screen. No matter what I try, it throws some error (mostly 'something went wrong'). Finally gave up. Never expected from Amazon. Oh well, no one is perfect. There is always webpage to fall back to. Wish I could get my old app back.

I've been a prime member since it's inception and use Amazon for nearly all my online purchases. This app is very easy to navigate and use. I have little to no issue with the app crashing. Wishlist is a fantastic feature for possible future purchases. I sometimes have issues with it's suggestions based on search history. Some products aren't relevant and I have yet to see any deals of the day as steals or must have products.

As a Prime Member who orders quite often, it shouldn't be this difficult now to do the following: Sort without losing 1000s of results. Sort within the category. Why do you have to keep going back and forth to filter the subcategory? Navigate. There should be an option to see all results on one page instead of this never ending next button. This new experience is very time consuming. These issues are very important for variety shoppers and needs to be addressed as soon as possible.

If I was able to give you a plethora of negative stars, I'd do it. There's already a pre-installed version, so why do I need another? I had purchased an item on Amazon, paid for the 3 to 5 day shipping, and I didn't get the item until 6 WEEKS later (they sold out but never mentioned on site), was enrolled in monthly subscription for that item, but nothing was mentioned. You treat your warehouse employees like literal slaves, with management forcing them to work overtime. Don't want this app!

it was good, but recently i add something to a wishlist ny using thebdrag feature, and it automatically adds it to the top list. i habe to go and manually delete things that end up im the wrong list, and it freezes, or wont click. also if i want more then ome item on a wishlist, it won't let me add it. i habe to manually add amounts from my computer. The features that are supposed to help save time, are becoming a bigger headache then its worth.

Souq has more choices of goods. Since it was changed to amazon, It seems that Im using a different online shopping platform. The things I used to see on Souq cannot find it anymore in Amazon. One more thing, it displays items which when you want to purchase it says delivery unavailable in your country???. I started using their competition which has now more choices or items than before.

App is overall really good but it only notifies you within the app so you have to stay glued to your phone. Missed out on a black Friday deal I had been waiting for for months due to the app telling me it would send my phone a notification. No notification actually went through my phone but when looking at the notifications section in the app I missed the deal twice!.....

Nothing is more frustrating than the lists on this app. Constantly, my lists keep getting mixed up. I put things on one list and next thing I know, everything is doubled onto another list which is a pain when there is more than one person on the other list so they see it and think things have been added that shouldnt have been. This bug is frustrating!!!

Completely unrelated ads in the app. I am searching for low carb items but there is a Geico ad at the bottom of the screen. Why does Amazon need advertising dollars this bad? Why is a Prime Customer forced to look at ads? Ebay, Aliexpress, Walmart and Target have more respect for their customers. They took away endless scroll just to force your eyes to ads in the app. This isn't the move of an industry leader, it comes off desperate and tacky.

Was a good and efficient app, but since the update it does not work at all. Cannot open this app...as soon as I click on it it says that app has crashed for some reason. Then when I open amazon music, the first message that pops up is "amazon shopping app has crashed" even though I haven't even opened the amazon shopping app and made sure it wasn't running in the background. Needs to be fixed, but as of now it is a useless waste of space.

Amazon, you guys are multibillion dollar company that has grown exponentially over the past decade but your development team still cannot design a user-friendly and non-half-as**d app? No we don't want the new search to be in a whole other tab, we don't want a half-as**d app, we want you guys to to fix your navigation page, we want the app to be quicker and easier to browse, but most of all, PLEASE just make it just a bit more user friendly. Thank you for reading this review.

3 stars because it is sometimes buggy and crashes (usually when I click the search bar after opening it) or is slow. I also wish there was a way to view the seller's page. I've only been able to get to the seller's page one time on accident and whenever I review my order there is no way to click on the seller name and check out their page to leave seller feedback or see where they're from to estimate shipping times.

Eliminated the Whole Foods integration. I have to now install another app just to get to the code for my account. Eliminating a basic FUNCTION and not even giving the Whole Foods STAFF a heads up is dumb. It's annoying for all of us in the Whole Foods line that were delaying everyone else, who were in turn delaying more. Yes, we can use our phone numbers, but I've never bothered to set it up because I NEVER HAD TO!

Why do companies insist on changing things that work perfectly well? The most recent update has changed the filtering system. Instead of something that overlays the main body of the app like before, clicking on "filter" now opens its own new page, and it will shove you back to the product list on each filter change. It is also slower to load than before. It was a much more fluid experience before.

If I'm swiping through products and my finger touches any "watch item" buttons to begin a swipe, Amazon adds it to my watch list. For every other app, that swipe doesn't click buttons, you have to touch it and then remove your finger. This seems to be intentional so that users accidently add items they don't want. If Amazon has any ethics they should fix this and apologize for the mistake. Otherwise I will assume it was intentional and stop my Amazon Prime subscription.

What is wrong with this app. It used to work now it just freezes or won't load up the picture I press to read about it, opening my wishlist is terrible and can't delete items off of it. People need to figure it out and update. And yes, I restarted my phone and turned it off it for an hour and still same problem. Uninstalled and installed it again, no changes. I'd say try the online website but that's just as bad. With holidays coming, I might buy in stores instead of here.

UH-OH. Something went wrong... Amazon, what is up with the constant oh something went wrong messages on this new version of your app? It is darn near impossible to find or view products with the version I just downloaded this morning. I thought it was something wrong with my phone, but no - this morning's download is just as bad as the one I downloaded last week!

The app is fine...except for one very annoying issue. The app is supposed to display your chosen list on the bottom, and allow you to long press on item photos and slide them into the selected list. This would be great if it wasn't completely buggy. The app frequently and randomly changes the list displayed at the bottom...and many times will show an empty space. This makes using the lists and comparative shopping a headache. This has been a problem for a while. PLEASE FIX IT AMAZON.

The bad; 1.Too many of the items don't ship to "my territory" 2.Despite the fact ROI is in the eurozone and no longer in the UK (for a while now), Sterling is the default on my browser. 3.I can nearly always find a better price in a local shop. 4. When I signed up to a Prime trial, I couldn't watch anything 'in my territory'. The good: 1.Searching for books so I can copy the ISBNs to order from a local bookshop.

This app is good, and I buy things on it all the time, but lately it has been exhibiting a problem in loading any kind of search. I usually have to find new items to add to my wishlist on a browser. I find this somewhat a big issue, but other than that, it works well and has a wide range of useful products and informative books.

Amazon is terrible- I had to pay for a broken item. Amazon (the seller) delivered a broken item, and scheduled a UPS pick up for the broken item that never came. UPS didn't accept the item when I tried to drop it off for a replacement. Customer service was useless. Wasted 4 hours of my life, issue was never resolved. No way for customer feedback or seller review, so I'm rating the app. Paid for a broken item. Furious.

As always, updates require a little bit of adjustment on user part. One issue I have, on my devices ia when I check the status of my orders and then click on "see all updates" the screen pops up but nothing is on it. I have to close the updates screen and click on "see all updates" again to get the info. This happens on my Android 9 tablet and phone and my Android 7.1.1 tablet, as well.

The filter function on this app is infuriating. When you tap on it, it sometimes doesn't respond. Other times it does respond but takes so long, you've now tapped twice and end up hitting the "Clear All" button on the filter list. What UI designer decided it was a good idea to put the "Clear All" button in the same spot as the filter drop down?

For shopping, this works great. But if you want to find any of the other features, they are stupidly embedded within the app...not intuitive to find or operate. Makes no sense! If you have that many programs, make a separate Amazon App that houses all of them....or make the programs easier to find in this app. I bet you don't have much traffic on these from the app ðŸ˜’

Starting today when I try to track a shipment the app opens then crashes soon after. When I am searching for car parts it tells me to confirm vehicle. I click that and it doesn't change the listed parts so I have to pick one that doesn't fit and update it that way. I can't speak on anything else right now because I can't gain access to the app before it crashes.

Get ready for spam calls!! I just signed up for Prime and was told I can get a $10 credit if I download the app. No credit was given. It just keeps telling me to complete Step 2 which is sign into the app even though I've completed that step numerous times now. AND the app said it needed access to literally everything on my phone. The very next day I start receiving tons of spam phone calls that I never got before. Kind of a coincidence?? I'm pretty sure they sold my phone number.

when on wifi(tested with multiple different networks)app will load any page properly at first, then switch over to the stupid dog errors that don't give any useful information. It is obvious it's able to load all the information, as the pages have all of the information before the error pops up. issue has been happening for years and has never been fixed.

Horrible car part shopping interface / user experience. The prior design worked well. I'm not sure what prompted them to reinvent the wheel. It seems whomever designed the new interaction has never own a car or bought parts (do some user research folks... buy a book on it). Sorry but this is a Sad, sad, sad design. Kudos for generating an emotional response though... I felt disgusted and so compelled to write this silly review in hopes someone at Amazon gets a clue.... :-)

Terrible! Horrible! The worse! Couldn't actually log on. There's so many security prompts I couldn't get pass the sign in. You have to verify your log on id and password with a 5 digit code after you verify a copy code but they send it to you in an email not a code key. The app doesn't let you toggle between apps. If you minimize the AMZ app after you hit "send code" to access your acct email, when you come back to it the sign in function starts over again. It literally just keeps sending codes.

I love shopping through Amazon but I get the "something's gone wrong" notification (with adorable dog picture) very often. It's frustrating when you're trying to buy things and you have to start everything all over each time period I was just trying to buy something for half an hour and I was not successful I had to restart 5 times. Other than that it seems to be a good app. But if it doesn't work and doesn't let me buy things isn't it shooting itself in the foot?

This app used to be great. Now the searching process is terrible! First, I have to tap it several times just to make the filter appear. Then, I can only select one filter at a time (I used to be able to select several filters before clicking "apply"). This means that I have to go through the process of tapping at least 2 or 3 times for each filter! Please fix this feature. It used to be great, so I don't know why that was changed in an app update, but please put it back.

PSA Galaxy S10 users!!! Do not update !!! If your app suddenly sucks , its due to the update. Go into application and uninstall the updates . Its working like it used to since I did this! Got my click and drag to wish list back and no more clicking arrow for next page when searching for items. Amazon , why the hell would you put out an update THAT MADE YOUR APPLICATION WORSE!!!??

1-you can't change how you see the items you search for: it's predetermined to put it in squares and two per line. 2- when i tried to change the display mode (witch there is nothing to customize in the settings option ) I got on the most annoying menu bar ever created: every time i needed to go back to select another option i took you back not to the previous menu, but to the main menu. 3- It's scrolling is very sensitive, it takes you to an item that you obviously didn't want to select

Amazon is going down. I have had some issues and not sure where its coming from. I got refunded for items not received that I did receive and when i inquired they said its okay. Keep the product and the money. my reviews don't always show up as verified purchases and they said it is because i ordered from my phone and not a laptop. I mever had these issues when i was ordering from a laptop or browser but it could be a pure coincidence.

I'm just reading all the reviews, and for the first time I would advise customers to beware of this app is it seems cause more problems and it's worse. I would search Amazon the way we all have previously. This is an app that Amazon got completely wrong should scrap it and recode it so it's easier for the clients. This ad in the seems to have been developed to benefit Amazon, not the customer. This app does not the make the customer shopping experience any better, but it makes it worse.

Please fix your app. I'm tired of being ejected from a really detailed review I spent a lot of time on just because you can't seem to recover from the Pixel 3's onboard camera app when I want to snap a picture of the item. Don't just ship it broken. Remove the option if it isn't freaking working right or add a clause in your logic to save the freaking review if the user backgrounds your app. Good ux programming is not hard, guys.

Have been using this app since I can't remember, but after the last update it will no longer let me print return labels, either from the app or from the email I am sent. When I click on "Print Return Label and Instructions", I am sent directly back to the Amazon home page without a label having printed. I called customer service on 9/7/19 and they seemed to know nothing of this problem.

Poorly executed app. It will not show your orders or purchase history unless you order directly from the app, which makes the app useless. I use my PC and Chrome on my phone sometimes, as well, and both provide a far superior experience. The app doesn't even recognize my Prime membership, even though I'm logged in. My PC and phone do. Until Amazon fixes this, I will not be using the app.

Not any issue with the app and highly recommend Amazon for most online buying and selling compared to eBay. Had many BAD experiences with ebay making a purchase of one item and being charged for a different item with a much larger price in a different country from the seller I made the purchases from but the issues were resolved in 48 hours by eBay since I had screenshots everytime and pictures with my back up phone as proof and still received the items quite a bit later due to issue.

UPDATE: Made an earlier review about crashes since the update. I'm not sure if this is what did it or not but maybe it'll help some of you having the same problems. I went into my apps and checked everything and noticed that the Amazon shopping app no longer had any permissions. Must've happened with the update So I turned on the permissions and now it's working great again. Hope this helps!

Love Amazon, but so frustrated everytime they do an upgrade it messes up the Giveaway feed. You start at the top of the giveaways and then if your half way down the page and enter for something if you don't win and press the back button to go to where you were, it doesn't go back to that spot. It goes all the way to the top of the page again!!! So you have to keep scrolling all the way down to where you were everytime after you enter something, that is major frustrating!!!

Was having crash problems today (10-1-19) along with many other people, but problem seems to be resolved as of 3pm. My password reset this morning seems to have triggered the problem. Temporary server snafu perhaps? Back to working as expected. Overall good app, easy to navigate. I use it mostly for tracking my orders, prefer desktop site for serious browsing and product comparison. Works fine for quick price research on the go, and my occasional reorders.

Amazon have removed filters to make it harder to get the best deal. Filter by lowest price and 90% of items can vanish.. But filter by highest and nothing vanishes... Amazon have removed the option to set dollar limits... In short Amazon are using the app to squeeze an extra few bucks everyone you place an order... I started to shift purchases to competitors..

Its ridiculous that Amazon app dont have a easy to locate Logout button and one have to waste good amount of time on youtube to learn how to signOut. I checked a few videos on YouTube but looks like Amazon found that people are providing tricks to signout and so in subsequent update they have disabled those options too... Awesome way to force people stay with you... Its horrible..

I never had a problem with this app until 2 months ago (so, an extra star for years of good service). The last 2 months or so... the app crashes and says, "we're sorry" and shows me sad pics of dogs. I called customer service and they were at a loss. I have cleared cache, uninstalled and reinstalled. I have had it with the app. Fix it!!!

I am an avid and longtime Amazon shopper, HOWEVER this app is becoming less & less customer friendly. My main grievance is with the search function, which used to bring me many offerings of exactly what I was searching for, but now invariably presents a torrent of inappropriate "sponsored" and otherwise totally incorporate suggestions. I receive 2-4 Amazon shipments per week, sometimes more, but lately, I am finding the shopping to be as tedious (and annoying!) as going to a "big box" store.

Its probably a bug or something but if it's not this pisses me off because it's been happening for the past few months now. I love using Amazon's services but this app is like a beta from 2012!! So laggy and the UI is just not intuitive. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE FIX THE PRODUCT REVIEW SECTION... Used to be a good app, probably a 4 out of 5. That was, however, until the latest update, which it looks like took away the "upcoming deals" element of the deals page. This still works on the desktop (and mobile) website. Why have you deemed it necessary to take this away? It certainly hasn't been an improvement to the app. Also, come on, work on the sluggishness when scrolling through long lists of items It is starting to get annoying.

It's started asking for access to my camera, but I dislike that idea, and can't see any good reason to allow it, so I've uninstalled it! Also, it kept notifying me of offers I wasn't remotely interested in, which I found very annoying, and it really didn't give me any benefit beyond what I already get via email. Waste of space.

Amazon is a good name but not good as what we think. as of summer 2019, you can no longer select multiple filters before applying them to your search. it REALLY slows down my workflow when shopping. the page loads require a second or two to load after each filter is applied and it makes me nuts. let me pick stars, department, brand, price, prime, sort order THEN apply the filters. oh and how about a free entry for price range?

I have been an amazon prime member for years. I paid extra for extras like audible etc. Apparently I'm not important enough as a customer - I was sent something I never even ordered AND charged for it!! I had so much grief trying to sort this out - customer service was so rude, absolutely horrible. I have screenshot of my dealings with them if anyone wants to see them. I have cancelled all my amazon memberships.

Newest version is worst update to a functional app - EVER! Totally useless now as it crashes immediately. I'm now back to using browser version. So much for Amazon being "High Tech". Only a 2nd rate operation would deploy such a worthless update. Update: Finally, after 2 days of installing/uninstalling, most recent update doesn't immediately crash. Filter still sucks big time. Page reloads after each filter choice making multiple filter choices a real headache.

It wasn't broke, but they tried to "fix" it. Bad move. The app is now hot garbage. No longer intuitive or user-friendly. Unable to search for or add wishlists of friends or charities. Filtering shopping results is now a ridiculous process of toggling back and forth so many times you'll get dizzy. Terrible app design. Time for the free market to prevail. Time to shop online with competitors who are better attuned to the comfort and ease of their customers.

the new app is horrible (Amazon itself isnt). Wishlists are no longer accessable by just long pressing the product and dragging it which also means, if you are a shopper who likes to add multiple product to wishlist and then quickly compare and only buy from your budget preference etc etc and keep the rest for next time, that's a no from Amazon. Forget the precise filtering. That's terrible now too. Bring back the old app.

If I could leave a big fat ZERO, I would. joined Amazon Prime and nearly takes an act of God to cancel the subscription, completely ridiculous. Needed to make some financial changes in my life, every penny counts but canceling Amazon was one of the most difficult & ridiculous process I've ever encountered. Poor customer service all around. WOW! HAPPY TO BE DONE WITH THIS ONLINE TRAP!

Had to remove 2 stars 1/30/2018... Not my dependable Amazon now....You blew away 2 day delivery and over night option to pay just a few $$ more. Prices gone up vs quaukity gone sown. such a shame. I use to just love and praise Amazon. They've worked on issues for me. Quick delivery on most items gone. Customer Service is good though. Wayyyy better than Walmart!

Glitchy as heck. It never remembers my list trays, it has misleading prices constantly, like where it will say "from $8.99" but when you click on it, not a single option is $8.99. Instead it's twice or triple the price. Prime isn't really a thing anymore. Some actually arrive in 2 days. A lot more often the item takes 3 or more days to even leave the warehouse. Very misleading. And you can't comment on reviews using the app or downvote irrelevant reviews. The old app worked better than this one.

This latest one is janky on many phones I've tried with no noticable improvement over the older app. Whenever I search for something and try to use the filter, it takes 4-5 seconds to open the menu. It's not a long time but long enough for me to try to press it again, only for it to finally pop up and my additional press registers on the "Back to Results" button. It's too infuriating and slow to use in it's current state.

Most of the features i liked about using Amazon to shop have changed. If you sort by low price most of the items are no longer viewable. I used to look up an item sort low to high then scroll through the hundreds of options for what i was looking for at the lowest price. Now I will get a random sampling of only a few items (maybe 20 or so) that start low and go high. Most of the mid priced itms are not even viewable in the low to high filter. I like Amazon but hate this app.

The app used to be preferable to the website, but recent updates have removed the "what customers bought after viewing this item" section which I found incredibly useful for comparisons. Sorting by anything other than "featured" removes most of the search results. Poor experience via the app. Amazon prices have been creeping up for a while, but with my prime membership I preferred the convenience. My prime has now expired, and the app is a frustration to use, so there isn't much to keep me.

App just keeps getting worse with every update. Totally unresponsive. Interactions on the page don't work for a couple of seconds after a page has loaded. Coupled with the fact that you can only apply one filter at a time before the page reloads it takes forever to filter results on multiple values. Can't open images on the product page until 10 second after the page has loaded. The app is thrash.

App would be great, but since the latest version was released, a problem with the search box arose. when you click in the search box, you have to click in the box again...a second time to bring the keyboard up. WHY?! very annoying! WALMART'S APP DOES NOT MAKE YOU DO THIS. if you fix this, id gladly amend my review to 5 stars...

under ground or prime version 16 was better. this new app version 5 is so slow i can text faster than it can load pages. it hangs up alot and my phone hs 32gb of ram and less than 18 months old. it is hardly usable do to its always loading. also it is super annoying that it does not retain your recent searches, so you have to retype everything for every search modification where underground did and it made altering your search quick and easy. i like how list were minimized thats it.

Great app, use it constantly. Great selection. Easy process. MFA can be painful but secure. However the push notifications do not work on my phone. It simply hangs and the app stops responding. Plus, in low data mode the app is not usable at all. Perhaps there could be a lighter version?

App is easy to use. Very descriptive and includes specs of objects. Customer service is 50% unhelpful and or just plain rude. Product delivery tends to be inaccurate. Package is marked as delivered, but many times, it hasn't been delivered yet. this tends to be an issue when there are important packages that get delayed during crucial times.

Amazon saves. But your Android app sucks. The problem is app not responding or crashing. Because of ads or videos or moving apps in the Amazon Shopping it slows down the app and the response time is slow. This app when it was downloaded via Amazon never was a problem. Now a customer get, "oh oh something went wrong" with dog frowning (I'm frowning too).

Real crappy interface. Many options are hidden away, and most of them don't even function. For example, there are official guides on Amazon's website on changing the shipping address on an order, but the only real way to do this is cancel the order, select the option "CHANGING THE SHIPPING ADDRESS", then pay extra to buy something because it has artificially "increased in price." Quite infuriating. BONUS: Prime membership cancellation is a pain, too, and sometimes they charge you anyway. ðŸ‘

Why oh why did you change the app. It worked perfectly before. Everytime I try to open it, it goes to install button etc. When I do get in, it's so slow. Before when I searched for something it was so easy and you could scroll til your hearts content, now there is a next button at the bottom. Hate it, hate it, hate. Will have to go back to E Bay I think

Changes were senseless. This app has went from a good user friendly app to one of the worst. Since the update I have experienced nothing but frustration. The filter is terrible, it no longer drops down and can only do one selection at a time. The app then freezes up so it then becomes a long waiting game. Wishlist was always visible and simple to drag items to list but thats changed for the worst and will freeze up when deleting an item from the list. Don't fix what's not broken.

Useless if you are not in the USA, wasted hours for nothing. I put in an Australian address, it wrote a line in the description of some items "eligible for shipping to Australia". First problem, no filter, so you have to wade through listings to see which say that. Made sure I only looked at items eligible. Then went to the check-out and, lo and behold, got error messages on all the items I had carefully selected saying "Amazon can't shop this to Australia". Profoundly disappointed, huge waste.

Hello, after you enter your card data, a very easy product is paid, just by touching the "buy now" button, without showing you that it was paid, twice happened to watch products like I'm in the wrong place to touch the "buy" button and I can still cancel it. Please put a filter or a step to finish the payment, I'm very upset, no application has such a payment system :(

You need to bring back the app Amazon Underground. It was a million times better. It really pisses me off you are forcing me to use Amazon shopping app. I miss my shopping lists being at the bottom of the app. Plus this new app you have to keep pressing the next button every so many items. The old one you just kept scrolling till you found what you wanted.

Old app worked great. With this one u have to go through pages. Can't just scroll back to the top. Takes forever. Very poorly set up. But let's face it we have no choice the old app is no longer supported. Just once I'd love to see a company do an upgrade that is actually an upgrade and doesn't make life more difficult!!

Amazon has a bad search filter. It puts its sponsored and suggested objects first and makes it near impossible to find something you're look for if it is specific. The different filters they provide are not usually helpful and when you choose to sort by a different requirement then it takes away most of your options. I believe that this could benefit from better filtration system when searching.

Using on 3 day old Galaxy Tab A with current OS UpDate.  Tried both Apps, they both keep crashing constantly. Cannot even login.
